content.title: HERD 2010-2017
keywords: NSF Higher Education Research and Development Survey (HERD)
The Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System (IPEDS)
content.description: This file includes publicly available Higher Education Research and Development Survey data downloaded from NSF in July 2019. HERD is the primary source of information on R&D expenditures at U.S. colleges and universities. The survey is an annual census of institutions that expended at least $150,000 in separately accounted for R&D in the fiscal year. In addition to R&D expenditures, this provides data on institutional characteristics (i.e., highest degree granted, historically black college or university [HBCU], high Hispanic enrollment [HHE], public or private control).
content.access_actions_required: Public / Open Access (no data use agreement required)
content.access_requirements: Public / Open Access (no data use agreement required)
content.data_usage_policy: These data are being provided for educational purposes for use in Applied Data Analytics program. Dataset may only be accessed and used by ADRF users who are members of a course using these data.
content.data_provider: Institute for Research on Innovation and Science (IRIS)

\ufeffyear.description: Fiscal year (ranging between 2000 and 2017) as defined in the data source, the NSF Higher Education R&D Survey (NSF HERD)

std_inst_name.description: These institution names are standardized; data retrieved from IPEDS via WebCASPAR downloaded and archived by IRIS (January 2019); most institution names were already standardized by NCSES IPEDS Data Center, but additional data processing was done by IRIS

toc_flag.description: Indicator for type of control of each academic institution: 1 = Public; 2 = Private

med_sch_flag.description: Indicator for each institution having a medical school included as part of its reporting unit: T = Has a medical school; F = Does not have a medical school

hhe_flag.description: High Hispanic Enrollment Indicator: T = Is a high Hispanic enrollment institution; F = Is not a high Hispanic enrollment institution

hbcu_flag.description: Indicator for historically black colleges and universities (HBCUs): T = HBCU; F = not HBCU

total_rd.description: R&D expenditures from the institution’s current operating funds that were separately accounted for, including expenditures for organized research as defined by 2 CFR 220 Part 200 Appendix III and expenditures from funds designated for research; expenditures came from internal or external funding and included recovered and unrecovered indirect costs; funds passed through to subrecipient organizations were also included; R&D was excluded if it was conducted by university faculty or staff at outside institutions and was not accounted for in the reporting institution’s financial records; data retrieved from NSF HERD

federal_rd.description: R&D expenditures, presented in thousands of dollars,  in all fields, including direct and recovered indirect costs, funded by all agencies of the Federal government; data retrieved from NSF HERD

city.description: City of the academic institution associated with each reporting campus / unit’s address

state.description: State of the academic institution associated with each reporting campus / unit’s address; there are 55 unique abbreviations for 50 US states and 5 territories

zipcode.description: US ZIP code associated with each academic institution’s (reporting campus / unit’s) address
